comment: One thing i can't get is at around 7:49 duration in video when you are teaching about cache misses by M2 wherein due to our orientation we are storing the 2 d array elements row wise in the cache line blocks but why do we not storing the 2 D array columnwise into row wise of cache lines so that it's the same 32 X 512 value also it's independent to M1 as given in ques???
why only the first element of each row is miss ? and how others are hit ?
how are we taking 4 words per block ?
Please make some engineering math videos or direct crash course before 2022. Would be very helpful!

Honestly , I am not able to understand this problem , why case miss per column is 512. Since only 256 lines is present in cache , and for every line  I think "only one  miss should be" , but  How 512 miss,  this is  part I am not to understand ....?  Plz clear my doubt. Thankyou.
Please upload engineeng maths videos also 🙏🙏🙏🙏
He forgot to swap indices in the matrix

@aaronemerick2719  i think you are understanding this so i have a question in the second method the row p2 in the cash the a[0][0] then a[1][0]then a[2][0] ...... at the same cach line then each one mus generate a mis

Because the entire set of array elements arr[0][0]-arr[0][15] are loaded into the block size same time. So only the first element count as a miss. If the were loaded individually, then they would all be counted as a miss
@maestrocorporate5804  I didn't get why they are loaded into each block at the same time
512 Misses per Column because the columns will keep getting overwritten.

Every column is missed because 1 .   Array is loaded into the cache row wise 2.  Since array is loaded row wise(even though entire row is not loaded) and with each increment of j we are trying  to access a different column so in every step of the loop we will get a cache miss

@mypowerlevelisover9000  if that's the case then why is he telling that the cache miss per column is 512 after all the first 16 elements are entered into the cache and so the elements should be : 512 ( total elements ) - 16 ( the no of elements entered into the cache ) = 496 and the answer should be should be (no of coloums) 512 * 496 ( no of misses ).

@krishwanthkishore8299  512 rows =2*cache length(256); write first column of cache: 0-255 rows, column 0-15  ---> cache (not finish); then write 256-511 rows, column 0-15 ---> cache;  Then check the second column of cache: should be 0-255 rows, column 1, but current value 256-511 rows, column 1. Reload the cache with 0-255 rows, column 0-15. and so on. so the every time read a new column. The cache needs reload.
